Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barbara M
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as we were travelling from Las Vegas to LA by bus and it stopped outside the hotel, Unfortunately this was the only good thing we could say about it. Do not be fooled by the reception area as the rest of the hotel isnt like it! This is a very basic poor hostel and not a hotel. Our twin room and private facilities were very small and shabby. The beds were uncomfortable and the pillows were non existent.The curtain did not close properly. We did ask for an upgrade but were told that this was as good as it gets. The reception staff were very unhelpful and were unable to offer advice and help about the area the hotel was in. 1 young lady pointed out the hotel on the map to us in the wrong location. There were four locks on the inside of the door which left us a bit nervous as to the necessity for this. There was also a huge crack in the shower tray. All in all a very unpleasant stay and one we would definitely not repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price”
Reviews.Author: Samuel C
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for around a week on and off and we found it great, especially as it was the cheapest hotel we could find in LA (even cheaper through websites rather than paying direct with the hotel). Rooms were small but clean and well equipped and staff were helpful and there was free Wi-Fi but only on the ground floor. For those without their own computer, we were able to use the computers at the Cecil's sister hotel next door. Wasn't the best area to be honest, but if you walk straight ahead from the hotel, you could be at LA Live in around 15 minutes & the metro in 10. Definitely avoid walking in the direction behind the hotel - there is really no reason to anyway and if you need to get the Grey Hound which is in that direction, get the bus on the corner (the hotel will give you details). For food, there's a super cheap Chinese takeaway (turn left out the hotel, and you will see it on the corner of the cross roads across the street) and a great pizza takeaway next door to that.

Reviews.Title: “Budget travel tip!”
Reviews.Author: TristanLane
Reviews.Content: Very cheap but good value for that. Lovely 1920's building, cheap room on the 15th floor. Shared toilet and shared showers. Room had TV. Lobby has free wifi. Good central location to investigate the scruffy underbelly of downtown LA. Helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Cecil Hotel, LA”
Reviews.Author: SEASHELL18
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel, clean room, small bed... No WIFI in room Good for a short trip in LA

Reviews.Title: “Suited our needs, as tourists..”
Reviews.Author: JustCotter
Reviews.Content: We were trying to book a place in L.A. online and as most travellers/backpackers will know, when travelling to several destinations (on a budget) it is often very hard to find a place that is safe, comfortable and affordable. I do not have high expectations as in my view i am there to see the city. We had some bad experiences with other places being falsely advertised or in bad neighborhoods with little assistance for staff sitting happily behind a desk. Here however, it ticked our boxes. YES- they do have shared bathrooms. I was NOT keen on this but we were running low on money and it was towards the end of a very long journey so the price was the most important factor. Even though i had been nervous, we actually had a great experience. They gave us a room on a quiet floor down a quiet corridor meaning i dont think anyone else actually used the bathroom that was consistantly clean. Also, as many have mentioned, the entrance and lobby are beautiful, though it doesnt reflect the rooms, it is a very nice welcome and very comfortable if you are down waiting for your laundry to finish, the laundry is very reasonably priced too. They also have free wifi. Our room itself was just a double bed and a sink, with a bedside locker, lamp, approx. 36 inch tv (not flat screen but what-evs) and some dresser drawers. Staff were friendly enough to us and helped us when we had problems or questions and have leaflets on everything. This is NOT a 4 or 5 star hotel but if you are considering it then i presume you are on a budget like we were. the price for us could not be beaten and though the area of LA itself is not 100% safe, it is close to transport and we as two 21 year old girls didnt have an issue. Maybe we're just brave though. :) Hope i've been of some help because surprisingly, even just to save a few bob, i would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “False advertisement”
Reviews.Author: Grmclane
Reviews.Content: All upgrades were in the front entrance and lobby., rooms, beds, bathroom have to be the worst I have ever seen.. 1 channel tv with snow, 1 iron for the whole hotel.. Need I say more!!!!

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: 422anonymous
Reviews.Content: Good hotelroom, small bathroom, not internett in the room, but in the lobby. no micro og fridge, but coffeeshop in lobby. nice bed, walkingdistance to subway and busses

Reviews.Title: “If you want cheap get this.”
Reviews.Author: rubenfrijns
Reviews.Content: We had a room with our own bathroom which was the only plus. There is no AC and it was hot in LA, so that didn't help in a good night's sleep. There is a fan on the ceiling which provides some 'cool' air. The room is small with only the basic thinks like a sink and some place to put your bags. The shower and toilet work, and that's it. It looked clean but not nice or welcome. If you're on a budget and can handle it being 90 or more degrees in the room then this might be for you, otherwise find yourself something else. You can park your car in the parking garage next door which costs you about $15 a day.

Reviews.Title: “i will return, i promise!”
Reviews.Author: st311a
Reviews.Content: most people have put bad reviews on this hotel, made me second guess my stay..... however.... the cecil hotel was awesome and friendly, they helped with maps and directions, even googled stuff for us... some people just expect too much so when they arrive, they get disappointed... it was safe, they had a 24hr security person! i recommend anyone to stay here, they freakin ROCKED! oh, so did the coffee shop "marty" awesome.... :) :) :) :) :) :)

Reviews.Title: “Best Upgraded Hostel”
Reviews.Author: MrCMartin
Reviews.Content: lTo begin, the Cecil Hotel may have been a very chic and glamorous hotel back in the day, but the decor now boasts that of an upgraded hostel set in the downtown Fashion District of Los Angeles. That being said, I really liked this hotel! I have stayed at other hostels in Ecuador and Chicago, but this was, by far, the best one. The lobby of the hotel is very nice as can be seen from several pics on here. The hotel staff was very friendly, and they were bilingual (English and Spanish). They even practiced with me as I tried my Spanish a bit. I reserved a queen bed with a bathroom for four nights ($69 a night with 4th night free), and for a place that I considered to be a hostel, it was great. The bed was a nice size and comfy, the closet was sufficient, the dresser had plenty of room for my clothes, and the bathroom was clean and filled with all my necessities. I didn't much care for only having a fan, but I know this is typical in LA. I liked being able to open the window to get a good breeze while I snoozed, but this was also a drawback because it was really noisy in the morning. Sirens usually woke me up before the alarm. Like I said, the bathroom was neat and had all my necessities. One of my worst fears is having to sleep in a place with ROACHES! UGH! Luckily, I never saw one in this hotel, and I looked every day when I entered that bathroom. Do not expect to take a bath, though, because they have it set up so that you cannot do so. I also paid attention to the shared bathrooms, and honestly, they didn't look that bad. Both the toilet and shower were in separate rooms that were singles. It's like they converted broom closets into one shower and one bathroom. Just take your stuff with you, and you're all set. They also looked very clean as I saw cleaning staff on the floors every morning. As for Internet access, this can only be accessed in the lobby and the coffee shop, which only has access to Stay's router. The Cecil's access is open, but Stay needs a password, which is "stayh0tel". Notice that the "o" in hotel is actually a zero. People mentioned how they noticed that some of the same people could be seen out front every day and night. Well, come to find out, they live there! I talked to one of the guys, who actually lives on one of the top floors and has been there for years. He just pays rent. There is no parking for the hotel, but you can pay a daily rate at plenty of local lots that are not too expensive. I'm used to paying $20 or more a day in big cities like Chicago. You might be able to get away with $7 to $10 a day here. TIP: If you are staying here on the weekend. Look for free street parking at the meters. Just make sure to read the signs because many of them say no parking between 2am and 5am. Take a chance and park in the Fashion District one block behind the Hotel like I did. I had free parking all weekend. Overall, this hotel is great for the budget-minded and those that want to meet other people from different countries because there were a lot of international travelers there.

Reviews.Title: “OH HECK NO!!”
Reviews.Author: Shannon K
Reviews.Content: We attempted to cancel all three nights originally scheduled online but I was advised that we had to give 48 hrs notice so we were only able to cancel 2 of the nights. For starters, the decision to cancel was after reading numerous bad reviews about staying at the Cecil. Such as no a/c in the room, no electrical outlets in the rooms, unresponsive staff to the needs of their customers, vagrants roaming inside the building and a stabbing on the 5th floor. (googled the hotel and most of this information was on tripadvisor.com) Also, when I called on 2 separate occasions speaking to 2 separate people they were both less then cordial. Now we intended on staying the 1 night we could not cancel to “try it out for ourselves” but after driving 6 LONG hours when we arrived at the Cecil at 1 am we were extremely disappointed and horrified by the surroundings. Police on every corner, people living in tents, sleeping bags, drug dealers and hookers not what you want to impress upon two teenage girls who were traveling with us for vacation. We expected to see some things but not to this degree. After exiting the interstate and driving past the hotel (with everyone terrified) we continued on and ended up staying at another hotel spending additional money and losing the money paid to the Cecil. I am sure the interior (from what I saw when we drove by of the entrance) is elegant but also per the reviews “don’t let the lobby fool you” we could not chance staying there and trusting that our vehicle would be safe when you have to park off site and walk to the hotel. Thus I cannot recommend or say that we will ever attempt to stay there again. And from now on I will check the trip advisor reviews prior to reserving anything in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Agilles10
Reviews.Content: Unless they renovated this place lately or something, I don't know what all the negative reviews are about. I stayed in a room on the 7th floor with a private bathroom. It was great. Exactly what I was looking for. I just wanted a cheap place to stay in as I wasn't going to be hanging out at the hotel, except to sleep and shower. The staff was friendly. The place was clean. I didn't see one bug. The room was small, but it was just me so that was fine. There was a fairly large TV with quite a few channels as well. The ceiling fan was really good as well. All the towels and linens were clean. Long story short, for about $48 per night for my own room with bathroom...I have no complaints at all! Nothing but praise really. If you're looking for a central part of LA though, downtown is actually a little out of the way. Hollywood is much more central, but you'd have to pay more for that reason.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: HeiriAarau
Reviews.Content: Actually I was positively surprised, since reviews here are very mixed. The staff was very friendly. Lobby is much nicer than expected, with a direct connection to a café. I reserved a room with two beds since I wanted to offer my brother a place to crash if we were out late. The beds were clean as well as all the towels, the toilet and shower. No roaches, no bedbugs. TV was OK, not the best but usable. There was some outside noise, but that I guess stopped around midnight, as I fell asleep I don't remember hearing it later on. Just like in many hotels, the room has a carpet - I generally don't like carpets for various reasons - so keep your shoes or slippers on. Shower is old, and I guess people were only 4 or 4 feet 8 inches tall because I, with 5 feet 7 inches was too tall. Nevertheless the shower was usable. A sink is in the room. Shower and sink clean too. Cups, soap, lotion, shampoo also provided. I would say: this hotel is very well located, however old, but if you only need a stay for a night or two, it serves one well. If you have never stayed in a 1 or 2 star hotel, then you might want to book some other hotel. Young travellers on a budget, and those who want to see the real life in the street, will be OK. No breakfast in the arrangment I had, but that was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Its for backpackers or students...”
Reviews.Author: Shenaniganz
Reviews.Content: It was awful. Its noisy, dirty and in a terrible location. Its more of a student/backpackers. The lobby looks nice but everything else was not. The staff in the hotel were unhelpful. It had no bar or restaurant facilities. The drinks machines in the lobby took my money every time without giving me a drink and the hotel reception take the attitude of 'its not our problem'. The rooms old and really in need of refurbishment. The locks on the doors were dodgy. Its in Downtown LA - 2 blocks away from dereliction, there are pan handlers on the streets outside and its an hour and a half away from anything you would want to see in LA. Not a safe area for 2 women to walk about at night.

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: SandraEd
Reviews.Content: The pictures of the lobby are lovely...but wait til you get in to the rooms. The first room the window didnt open and the overhead fan didnt work. So no air at all. I asked for another room on an upgrade and said I was prepared to pay for it as long as I had a better room. They gave me one but it was no better. The handbasin was IN the shower recess but at least had my own toilet. The fan though only worked when the light switch was on which wouldnt have been good for sleeping all thru the night. So I rang down to see if there was another room I could have but while I was talking to them the cord fell out from the handset so I went down in the very slow lift to the desk to talk directly to them. They gave me my third room and I kept my fingers crossed. BUT the power point was too loose to hold my cell phone charger in & it kept falling out. No chair to sit on. The fan worked but only on one speed (full on) and as the room is so small there wasnt any space to move the bed out a bit so I slept (?) with a sheet covering me to try to ease the blast of the fan. Weird cos this was the middle of summer. So in the morning I said I wasnt staying for the other 2 nights I'd paid for and asked for a refund but they said as I'd booked thru Expedia I would have to ask them. So I rang instead, the Ritz Milner, where I had stayed on another 2 visits and they luckily had a vacancy. Its not far (Sth Flower St) and I went there. But The Cecil is not a hotel..its only equivalent to a backpackers. If you want that then good but they misrepresent themselves with the pictures on their website. Its a very low class old place but if thats all your budget can cope with then stay there but be aware of the class of hotel it is! The location is OK and the area is quite good. Nothing to worry about. Just the rooms are so very different from their pictures on the website!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A weekend in a very tiny room”
Reviews.Author: Justicecadet
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not for everyone. If you want a cheap, small yet clean room for the weekend it will probably suit you fine. The rooms were quite clean and I never saw any vermin or stains but the hallway smelled like smoke. The service was lacking. We had to ask for extra pillows and sheets three times before they arrived. Probably the most important note is that it is between the nicer part of LA and the sketchy part. So just be a bit more cautious.

Reviews.Title: “Ariiite hotel but watch out for the homeless!”
Reviews.Author: sparklez18
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed here whilst over New Year. We literally only chose this hotel as it was the cheapest we could find. I would stay there again as it wasn't too bad. Had no problems with the service, theres a nice little cafe which you can get too from the lobby..very polite in there :) Yeah the room is pretty tiny but your in LA, your going to spend hardly anytime there!! Good mix of people who stayed at the hotel, most of the people were young Americans! The only thing that freaked me out a little bit is all the weird people that stay/live there...It's kind of like a homeless shelter...didn't quite understand that part..but we were never bothered by these people! The only other thing if you are a tourist....we ended up getting the tube everyday to like Hollywood, so in future I would look for a hotel abit nearer to the touristy stuff! All in all....if your on a budget stay here...it's not too bad :) Oh there is wifi in the lobby but most days it hardly worked..if your an internet geek like me...I found it quite annoying!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky Hotel for the Adventurous”
Reviews.Author: kurtsample
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel for those who are just looking for a place to sleep while they are staying in Downtown Los Angeles. Mo mints on the pillow, no on-demand movies. no irons, no coffeepot in room. Merely a comfortable bed with clean sheets and towels. The shared bathrooms/showers were kept immaculately clean and the staff were friendly. As far I observed - NO part of downtown Los Angeles is free of the "scary" folk that defines a big city. The Cecil is located near anything you need and mass transportation so to me, trying to save money on a conference I was attending, it was the perfect choice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cecil: Great value for travelers on a budget in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: Dirty_A_1123
Reviews.Content: Location: Let me start out by addressing a common complaint about the Hotel Cecil; the immediate neighborhood in which the hotel is situated. I will admit that some of the reviews on here left us a little nervous about arriving at the Cecil late at night (11pm) with two suitcases and several hundred dollars in US cash. Our fear quickly became the subject of self-ridicule as the ten minute walk from the 7th St. Metro Station seemed as safe and uneventful as any such stroll in any large US city. A few sleeping bag-toting individuals slept in crevices and alleyways, but nothing out of the ordinary or of a threatening nature. The Cecil's principal highpoint is the location: Downtown LA. Downtown's central location in the city makes it a great base point for commuting to all of the greater Los Angeles area's points of interest. There are numerous local bus routes that service the area around the hotel and at least two (maybe more) Rapid bus stops within extreme proximity to the Cecil: the 720 to Santa Monica and the 733 to Venice Beach (this one literally stops outside of the Cecil's front door). The Cecil is also within a 10 minute walk from the 7th St Metro Center Station (Red Line + Blue Line (useful if coming from LAX)), as well as about an 8 minute walk from Pershing Square Red Line Subway Station. The Cecil is also walking distance to many of Downtown LA's local attractions. There is a 24 hour mini grocery/convenience within a five minute walk (west on 6th I think it was) as well as a Rite Aid and Walgreens west on 7th. While I did not rent a vehicle during my stay, I did notice plenty of private parking lots within close proximity of the Cecil (which does not have its own car lot). Hotel: The lobby of Hotel Cecil is probably the most stunning part of the physical building: it has a classic appeal with shiny marble floors, bright chandeliers, gold trim, and tasteful statues. This could easily be the lobby of a 4 or 5 star resort. The Cecil houses a coffee shop with patio (supplied with some basic toiletries and such), as well as a mid-deck business-type lounge (usually littered with technology abusers taking advantage of the free wireless internet). Hotel staff were friendly and helpful, and an armed night guard guarantees the safety of both patrons and staff. The Cecil supplies guests with basic hygiene amenities (soap, conditioning shampoo, lotion, toilet paper) and hairdryers (which I did have to request, but was delivered without hesitation). The Cecil's weakest point aesthetically would have to be the accomodation level hallways. The transition from glamorous lobby to the aqua green, industrial-tasting corridor was somewhat drastic. There was a slight odor of cleaning product but that shouldn't be seen as a bad thing. Anyways, the hallway serves the purpose it is designed for; transporting you efficiently from elevator to hotel room. The Room: Being on a university budget, I opted for the cheaper "shared bathroom" accomodation but was pleasantly suprised when I opened the door and saw that we had been given a free upgrade to a room with a bathroom (perhaps because of our latenight arrival?). Although I cannot properly comment on the communal facilities, there appeared to be several shower and toilet stations on each level, the showers themselves looked quite clean and were nicely tiled, I also never noticed the fomation of people "queued up" waiting to use the facilities (although I was staying sunday-thursday mid February). The room itself both met, and exceeded at times, my expectations for the price and rating. Do not go expecting the image shown on the Cecil's website and you will not be dissapointed. Expect two star accomodation and you will be satisfied. The room itself was compact (from what I've experienced is the norm in budget, older, mid-city accomodation). The decor was tired, yet maintained a somewhat historic charm (the Cecil must be nearly a century old, if not more). Ceilings were tall enough, and the sliding window was quite large. The room was overall clean, although if I was pressed to name the "dirtiest" part of the room it would have to be the carpet, particularily the seam between the carpet and the baseboard. The bed and mattress was newer and firm enough, sheets and blankets were crisp and clean. The pillows were somewhat weak, they felt as though they had been stuffed with cottonballs. There is a large dresser as well as a telephone, television, and alarm clock, and a large closet equiped with an iron. The bathroom was overall clean. The sink and toilet appeared almost new. The tub/shower was older but clean, although the shower head was a little disgusting with green and white calcium build up. I cannot stress enough that if you keep your expectations in line with what you paid for the room you should not be dissapointed. The Cecil is ideal for those who will use the hotel simply for nighttime accomodation. I will conclude by saying that Hotel Cecil deserves a fair chance amidst the barrage of negative reviews on this site, most of which I disagree with. Visit the Cecil with an open mind and do not expect more than the price can offer. Accept the fact that Hotel Cecil is a budget establishment and you will agree that the value achieved by both price and location simply cannot be beat .

Reviews.Title: “No matter what the deal on this hotel, you will not happy at the Cecil!”
Reviews.Author: bjcrystal
Reviews.Content: I could not believe the pure manipulation of the website photos compared to the reality of this hotel! The foyer is all this old european style hotel has going for it and makes you feel like you stepped into a luxury hotel. But once you step off the elevator, you may have well have stepped into the Bates Motel! I've seen Motel 6's that are classier than this place. We actually went back down stairs and asked where the room is that they have advertised on the internet. They acted as though they didn't know what we were talking about. They said they only had one other room if we wanted to switch. We looked at it and it was the exact same! The place was filthy. My skin was crawling the whole time we were there. We looked into getting another hotel but it was All-Star weekend and there wasn't anything we could switch to. We were stuck!! We luckily had a bathroom in our room but had to walk by communal toilets and showers in the hallway. The room was so tiny it only had a bed and dresser with a tv. No chair, no space to put your suitcase, no plugin in the bathroom at all and the only outlet we could find was behind the dresser. We had to call down for soap and shampoo after the first day our room was cleaned and it was not replaced. This took 1 hour and 45 minutes. What hotel is so cheap that they can't replace the soap and shampoo? The walls were VERY thin and we could hear the complete converstation of the guests next door...even at 3 am. The bathroom vent was directly connected to the one next door and it was if they were urinating in our own bathroom!! On the other side of us was a party with people coming and going all night which let out the pot fumes with each pass. We asked for blankets one night and they came up with paper-thin twin blankets 2 hours after the call. This hotel is scary! The last morning I woke up with a bite on my leg. When I asked if they had a bed bug problem the desk clerk tried to brush off my question and tell me they have been inspected, but I pushed further and said he didn't answer the question. Turns out they had just been infested within 6 months of our visit. DO NOT GO HERE! I am so glad we didn't take our kids to this place. It was supposed to be a romantic getaway for my birthday. My husband spent the weekend apologizing for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL IN HISTORY, DONT GO!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: an0nym0us999
Reviews.Content: I wish i would of read the reviews first. It is horrible! Unsafe! No Parking!!! I entered the lobby, it looked pretty nice, we checked in and in the elevator we go, The elevator can only hold up to 5 people, if you had more than 5 you had to wait. We went up, the hallways smelled TERRIBLE! The reason for the smell is because across the rooms there are bathrooms and showers,YOU DONT GET YOUR OWN! There was also holes in the showers. Wasn't pleasent but we entered our room and guess what,dust,stains,small,cramped,NO AC and so many more problems! If you wanted a fan you would have to pay extra per night! The doors were so weak that you could hit it open if it was locked! NOT SAFE! There was only 1 small bed for a family of 5! We went down to the lobby and asked why there was one small bed for our family they replied " Its for 2 people sorry" When we booked we put 5 and told them to look it up and it said for 5 she didnt have anything to say but we can switch you to two TWIN beds but still it wouldnt be enough space so we wanted to leave to a different hotel. we wanted to know if there was wifi but it was near the stairs not in the bedroom. She charged us $80 and we didnt spend the night!! Refused to give money back! Dangerous at night lot of achoaol, cocainne and ghetto area! We went to the Wilshire hotel, it is a wonderful hotel with friendly staff and a lot of hotel remedies!! DO NOT RECOMMEND THE CECIL HOTEL!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: Kristilouis
Reviews.Content: So were a couple who have been staying in hostels and we found thus place which is about $5 more a night then most hostels and it was great yes it's share bathrooms but they were right out door it's not the safest part of town but I would rather saty there then 4 blocks down the street plus they had 3 grauds on at all times during the night it had a lovely cafe and the service is great for a budget hotel it's the best you will find in downtown l.a and by far the safest

Reviews.Title: “Cheap”
Reviews.Author: jackieca
Reviews.Content: The Cecil has a beautiful lobby and a very nice coffee shop, but it is a budget hotel. I stayed there twice, walked in without a reservation and got a room for 2 for $60 including tax. And yes, we had our own bathroom and shower. I suppose for a lower price there are rooms available hostel style with shared bathrooms. It's an inexpensive, no frills place to stay. Obviously this attracts certain kinds of people, those looking for a cheap place to stay. If that's not what you're looking for, then this hotel won't appeal to you. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms were small and clean with no air conditioning, but they supplied fans on request. There is no parking, but there is a good indoor locked parking lot right next door for $15. Restaurants and bars within walking distance. I enjoyed my stay, and would recommend this hotel to the more adventurous type looking for a budget place with an interesting clientele.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever !!!”
Reviews.Author: don_matte
Reviews.Content: Hello everybody! Facts to this Hotel: 1. No Airconditioning 2. unbearable loude 3. dusty old room - with a too small bed - clean bathroom (except the shower) 4. Downtown - BUT! - no savety outside - at night and during daytime a lot of homeless people, who are bagging all the time ! 5. AND parking for 24h is very expensive ! (16-20$) Result : If it's possible : STAY AWAY OF THIS HOTEL !!! PS, Don't get confused by the pictures on the homepage !

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE. GHETTO. PAY A FEW EXTRA DOLLARS TO GET ROOM AT ANOTHER ANOTHER HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: B0ssyNBAD
Reviews.Content: So a friend & I did not book a hotel room until we started driving to LA from another part of CA..we found this hotel on priceline.com & booked a room being that it was so cheap & we did not want to spend a chunk of money on a place we were not going to be at all day. BIG MISTAKE. PLEASE DO NOT BE CHEAP WHEN IT COMES TO GETTING A HOTEL ROOM. The outside of the building is kind of run down & dirty, do not let the pictures fool you. But the inside lobby was nice..beautiful marble floors, nice color scheme, but very very old school. Older than old school. I knew something was up when they handed us our keys..they look like dorm room keys!! So we get in the elevator, which btw smelled terrible..like garbage. When we get to our floor & are trying to find our rooms, we see the "community showers & toilets." WE WERE NOT INFORMED OUR ROOM DID NOT HAVE A BATHROOM. The shower would make you calustrophobic. It looked like a place where a rapist would get u or where someone would stash a dead body. I also did not like the idea of sharing the shower!! There was no barrier to the shower or anything it was just a door seperating it from the hallway..& the toilets. OMG. There was doo-doo smeared all over one of them. By this time we were already disgusted & didnt even find our room yet. The hallways were hot being that there is no air conditioning & it smelled foul. & THEN we found our room. We put the key in & it didnt even work. Thats because you had to almost break down the door to get in. The smell of smoke & old man cologne was in the room. It had holes & rips in the carpet & had a sink. The mattress was cheap & when you looked out the window it looked like you were in the projects. Every single screen on every window was bent & or torn as if sum1 were trying to get in or jump out. & were talking the 14th floor. We were pissed because this was not what we expected. We complained to priceline & the front lobby & were told we cannot cancel this reservation without being charged for the night. & while on the phone, the cleaning lady barges in even with our "do not disturb" placard on the door knob. Because we could not cancel this, we decided to upgrade our room. So we are moved to the 9th floor..this time the elevator smelled like straight up armpits. The hallways smelled the same, like garbage, & our lock on the door was flimsy. BUT we had a bathroom. It had a toilet & sink, but no tub. There is just a shower head on the ceiling so basically the whole bathroom was the shower with a toilet in it. There was this creepy little vent on the wall that creeped the crap out of me because it was like someone could be watching. But we tried to make the most out of it so we turned the tv on while we got ready to go to the beach. When we were leaving, we did not bother to turn the tv off & again put up our "do not disturb" sign. Hours later when we returned, our tv was off. Everything else was in place, I didnt think the cleaning lady was in there. We were a little creeped out but joked around that the place was haunted. I wouldnt doubt it, being that its old & it looked like a place where you would go after your wife kicked you out & commit suicide. It reminded me of the movie The Shining. Everything about the place was creepy..very diverse guests, BUT crackheads & bums surround the area. Even in the lobby. Very, very unprofessional..but anyways!! We were very glad to check out. But upon checking out, I asked the guy working if the hotel was haunted. He had a look on his face as if we were already supposed to know, & said so casually, YES. We started laughing because we thought he was joking around, but I asked why? He says, "Well this hotel has been around since the 1920's & there have been murders & suicides throughout the years.." My mouth dropped!! My friend then asked, "Are there timers on the tvs?" & he said no..but ppl ask ALL the time. So we are scared to be in that place so we hurry out of there..on our long drive home, I start to google the history on this place. Sure enough, it comes up as one of the haunted hotels in la. Its a historical landmark, the 1st hotel in la to have 3 stories. Its also where movie stars used to hang out, & also a place where a few movie stars committed suicide..I still cant believe we stayed in that dorm-like piece of trash but please..if you do not wish to have an experience like this, splurge a little.

Reviews.Title: “Take other negative reviews seriously... this is a flophouse not a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Missy025
Reviews.Content: ... and I need to qualify b/c I actually was checked into STAY - the hostel group that rents (and has renovated) a few floors of the Cecil. (I will be posting there as well.) Why am I writing here? B/c while Stay rents a few floors and all in all isn't a bad hostel choice, it shares stairways and elevators with the Cecil and the occupants of the Cecil are FAR from the cheerful international travel bunch that frequent hotels. There is nothing to keep the unsavory occupants of the Cecil from going onto a STAY floor. I walked down the stairs several floors (out of curiousity) and the hallways and doors of the Cecil were disgusting! Dirty, smelly - gross. Really, this is a flophouse - and to even have it listed on a hotel site is seriously misleading. If you really need a cheap place to stay, at least check into the STAY side to get a better room (remember hostel) and keep a close eye on your surroundings. I also got a room with a bathroom and essentially locked myself in. Also, this area of town is not a good place to walk alone after dark....but really, with all the deals on hotwire and priceline, I'd bet you could get something better, at least safe, for the same price. (PS the lobby is beautiful and the coffee shop great but that is truly it!)

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay At The Cecil Hotel”
Reviews.Author: flygyrlc
Reviews.Content: Okay, I'm thankful we were able to get a refund from sidestep, but this place is a misrepresentation of a hotel. Do not trust the website. It's a lie!!!!! This is so not a hotel , but more so a dorm room for rent. First of all, i've never heard of a hotel that didn't have bathrooms inside the rooms, what!!! who does that?? The bathrooms don't have sinks nor toilet paper and the showers are in rooms outside of the hotel rooms, wierd... how sanitary is that? The rooms are old school. The full bed is the size of a twin in a half, so not a full. There is old sinks in the room, an old tv, and a rusted closet, old dresser and medium size mirror. It's tacky, it's looks like old apt buildings, that were renovated into bedrooms. DON'T BE FULLED BY THEIR OOH SO NICE LOBBY AREA. IT'S ABOUT THE ONLY THING NICE IN THIS HOTEL. DORMITORY BATHROOMS ARE SO COLLEGE AND THIS IS AN ACTUAL HOTEL. THIS HOTEL IS SO NOT KOSHER!!!! Don't stay here, it's totally misrepresented and those pictures of the rooms, are straight lies!!! it's scandless

Reviews.Title: “UNSAFE DANGEROUS -- DO NOT LET $$ BE YOUR MOTIVATOR”
Reviews.Author: LuvsAGoodDeal
Reviews.Content: I have read countless reviews stating that they stayed here and would recommend it because of the "value, " even though there were "weird people, beggars, gangsters, and a guy that was just released from prison here that was staying here." Please do not mislead people. Yes, it's cheap, but this place can cost your life. Just today, a paramedic came on a call here, and just walking up the stairs, two men casually strolled pass him and stabbed him multiple times. Thankfully, the wounds did not puncture vital organs but if he did not received immediate attention, it would have been a close call for him. He's currently under observation at the hospital now. My friends are firemen and have to come on calls here all the time because of drug addicts who stay here and now the motel have recently been more infested with gang bangers, looking to make a name for themselves. DO NOT STAY HERE, EVEN IF IT'S CHEAP!! This is downtown LA and it's cheap for a reason!! The bathroom is even down the hall and not in your room! Come on people---Please don't give these criminals a target for senseless acts of violence. STAY AWAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive front, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: magpie5774
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a wonderfully impressive front, but as you delve deeper into the hotel the upkeep is apparently lacking. I enjoyed the character of the 1920's style rooms, but the severely awful recent (?) decor left me cold. It's located in a very, very dangerous looking area with gangs all hanging around looking menacing. Parking is non existent if you're driving and expect to pay at least $10 a night in overnight car park charges. Free wi-fi is available but only on the mezzanine floor. There is a cafe attached to the entrance for coffee and bagels but you'll have to travel into town to find anywhere with a decent sized meal.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel i ever stay”
Reviews.Author: oceanb70
Reviews.Content: I had stay in American Choice(A 1 star hotel) before, this Cecil Hotel is way behind a 1 star hotel. I will never ever visit this hotel again even it's FREE. The room is as bad as the cell i visited in Alcatraz (San Francisco). I really doubt it's a 2 star hotel. - The so call 'Queen' Size bed is equal to the single bed in American Choice. - The SHARED toilet along the corridor got no place to wash hand. - The Room got no A/C nor fan. - The basin is rusted.

Reviews.Title: “A sub-tropical hell-hole!”
Reviews.Author: halterburn
Reviews.Content: The Cecil is possessed of neither air-conditioning nor internet access, despite making mendacious claims in its advertising to both. Avoid the place like the plague! Because, sitting on my bed, showered yet positively steaming, in a room that lacked even a fully-opening window for ventilation, I opted (rather than endure one night in this sub-tropical hell-hole) to go straight back to the Greyhound Station and spend the night on a much more comfortable Greyhound Bus. In retrospect I'm glad I did: the Cecil is the pits!

Reviews.Title: “I thought it was pretty good”
Reviews.Author: kitschykitty
Reviews.Content: Everyone warned us about the neighbourhood/location of the hotel. We were apprehensive at the beginning, after reading the reviews of the hotel and hearing the stories. But truth be told it was alright. The hotel looked nicer/cleaner than we had expected it to be. We got a free upgrade, and our room was okay. I mean, sure it wasn't spacious and luxurious but we weren't expecting too much. Afterall, for the price we paid (60-70 in total a night for 2 of us) the only other decent alternative would be an 8 bed hostel room. The lobby looked really pretty, even though i wouldnt say the same about the rooms. Then again, at least the rooms were clean and cozy. There are even lounges on the 2nd floor for people to hang out/use the wifi at. Pretty cool stuff. The neighbourhood was quite dodgy, with lots of weird beggars hanging around, and we saw a couple of sketchy occupants going in and out of the hotel, but it was fine for my friend and i (both girls), so it should be fine for you as well. Of course nobody's telling you to go out in the middle of the night and expect it to be safe. But otherwise i thought it was okay, especially with the low price. Oh, and the hotel staff were amazing. They were friendly and funny, which made the stay even better!

Reviews.Title: “This is more of a backapackers hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulCr
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here as a stop off on our backpacking trip around the world. Firstly I would not recommend this hotel to business people etc looking for a bargain. It is very basic with a TV and shared shower facilities. The hotel is located in an undergoing regeneration project of downtown L.A, if you keep going east on 7th you will feel very unsafe so go west when you exit the hotel which brings you more into the financial areas of downtown L.A where lots of good bars can be found such as Caseys. The staff were very friendly though and very helpful so full marks for them. Again to get to the point.....only stay here if you are backpacking and on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: flondavey
Reviews.Content: i was a little nervous as we arrived at the cecil hotel having read all the other reviews. i was amazed to see the beautiful marble lobby and be greeted by such friendly staff. the room was spotless, great amenities, great views...what more could you ask for. the surrounding area was interesting with lots to see and do. great location for access to public transport and the fashionable downtown bars and restaurants. if you stay here make sure you visit 'coles' on 6th street. the oldest bar in LA and the place that invented the dipped sandwich. we originally booked 3 nights but enjoyed our stay so much that we extended for another 2 nights. i have travelled to many countries around the world and stayed in a whole range of accommodation from hostels to 5* hotels and i really have to say that the cecil hotel was great value and a sound place to stay. we never encountered the strange goings on outside the hotel, and as for taxis being too scared to stop outside...there was a taxi waiting outside at all times for the guests use!! dont take my word for it. try the cecil and have an amzing time in wonderful LA.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely an adventure”
Reviews.Author: tuvocwannagohome
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with a friend who flew in from out of town. We're young starving college students, so price was the main driving factor behind us choosing the Cecil Hotel. We figured as long as we kept tabs on each other, the location wouldn't be too much of a problem, and my friend already lived in a less than savory part of another city, so she knew how to avoid trouble with people we might encounter. When we arrived, we didn't have high expectations, but that wasn't really an issue. The staff was nice, they answered our questions no problem, and we went up to our room. The lobby looked decent and clean, and the hotel itself had a lot of character. When we got off the elevator, we looked around, and the ceiling had exposed pipes, the paint looked kind of old, altogether it was by far the most INTERESTING hotel I've ever stayed at. It wasn't the kind of bland clean look of a standard hotel, it was kinda gritty. We got a room with no bathroom, again to save money, and the communal bathroom was down the hall. The room just felt kind of old, it wasn't particularly dirty or anything, just old. The bathroom was small, kind of dim lighting, but I didn't expect much more. They leave a roll of toilet paper in your room (we didn't find ours so we searched other floors until we found some left in a bathroom) then it was on top of a shelf we noticed when we got back to our room. Its an old building, and the neighborhood is... colorful. Coming back in the evening, we were approached by a man recently released from prison (he showed us his "LA COUNTY JAIL" shoes and everything) asking if we had any money, but we politely told him we didn't and he thanked us anyway and we went inside. The lobby was well lit and there was always some sort of staff there, which made us feel more secure. When we got hungry that evening, we made a judgement call to not go outside, so we went down to the hotel desk and asked which pizza places would deliver. They helped us find a place, and were really helpful. During the day, there were still homeless people outside, but no one bothered us as we walked to the metro. I was apprehensive at first about the location and encountering problems, but if you just keep an open mind, walk with confidence, and be polite, hopefully you'll have as good an experience. My stay there was a unique experience, and is really the only hotel I've ever stayed at that I'm able to remember. We viewed the hotel itself as part of an adventure, and not just a place to sleep. I would not recommend it for people with small children, but for its a cheap place to stay in an interesting part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Read my review! You will understand why this is a terrible hotel!”
Reviews.Author: intl_hotel_tester_ny
Reviews.Content: Attention! STAYING HERE AT YOUR OWN(!!!!) RISK! +Do you wish to be robbed? +Do you want to hear women screaming for help at night? +Do you want to live next to stinking persons? +Do you want to sleep in a very dirt place? +Do you want to share your bathroom with 20 other people? +Do you want to share your TOILET with more then 20 people? +Do you want to watch gang activities at night? +Do you want to be asked for crack,heroin and cocaine in FRONT of the hotel? +Do you want to take a walk on streets that smells bad because of URINE? +Do you want to live in a room WITHOUT cooler or EVEN without a fan? +DO YOU WANT TO LOOSE MONEY? YES??? = Then *****WELCOME TO THE CECIL HOTEL!***** The place where you would feel comfortable if you agree with all "do you´s" ! Right in the CENTER of Los Angeles DOWNTOWN you will see lot of gangs and crime activity. ( by the way= just type the hotel´s name in youtube and you´ll find shooting video in the front of the hotel) Entering in the lobby is REALLY AMAZING! 4,5/5. Clean and beautiful! But the surprise begins when you enter your room! It feels like to stay in a hotel of the 1960´s! THE WHOLE HOTEL STINKS!!! PLEASE DO NOT VISIT! THANK GOD WE ARE LEAVING SOON! The Soda machine is not refilled since 2 months, the rooms are dirty, NO TOWELS! ( sometime they put your old towel back and you think its a fresh new one but HEY! SMELL!! This is the MOST terrible and shocking hotel i EVER visited. Due to my profession, i travel extremely often to the whole wide world. ATTENTION= If you need a Taxi= FORGET IT! NO CABS ARE EVEN IN THE NEAR! YOU KNOW WHY? THEY ARE SCARED TO GET ROBBED ! You´ll have to call 15-25 times. My Review: This HOTEL is VERY TERRIBLE! 1. Outside ( in front of the Hotel) -Lot of guys who haven´t take a shower since 3 weeks. ( Actually thats not their fault= They are homeless :( ) -Smell of urine in the WHOLE neighborhood! -Ask for DRUGS, ILLEGAL ACTIVITIES =0/5 2. Lobby -No sitting possibility. Looks amazing and is clean! Just wow! (but wait until you enter your room...) -EXTREMELY hot! NO Air condition! =3,5/5 3.Front desk -Employees are very(!) unfriendly! if you have a problem in your room, the just say= ok, will fix it. but after 3 weeks not even a check by an plumber. -Employees are VERY(!!!!!!!!!!!) capricious! -No money to change( you need quarters for the laundry) =0/5 4. Hotel Room **HERE BEGINS THE NIGHTMARE** -VERY HOT -NOT CLEAN -DIRTY FLOORS -ABSOLUTELY NO COMFORT! -SHOWER WATER IS COMING DROP BY DROP -EXTREMELY TINY ROOMS -YOU HEAR YOUR NEIGHBOR SNORING OR WATCHING TV. -TV SYSTEM OUT OF ORDER -JUST ONE ELECTRICAL PLUGS(ONE OF THE TWO IS USED FOR TV=MEANS JUST ONE ELECTRICAL PLUG) -NO FAN -NO COOLER -NO AIR CONDITIONER -NO WARDROBE -NO TOILET PAPER(YOU HAVE TO ASK FOR) -BED LIGHT WORKS SOMETIMES -VERY OLD DOORS AND UNSAFE ( i forgot my keys inside= i just punched and TADAAAAA= Open :) =0/5 (!!!) TOTAL SCORE= 3,5/20 DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!! STAYING AT YOUR OWN RISK! HIGH CRIMINAL RATE!!!! (check online @ lapd) I hope you liked my review! Good luck if you stay here, Intl. Hotel Tester. June 2009

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. clean. separate parking garage. wierd neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: swimmerboy6
Reviews.Content: me and my guy wanted to stay somewhere nice and low cost and near his place of work. For the money we paid...like 60-70 dollars I was very impressed. nothing scary. sure u don't want to be walking around at night as there are lots of homeless ppl but just stay out their way.besides what do u expect, its skid row. but its right in downtown close to all the metro rail, historical buildings, interesting restaurants and shops. There are taxis everywhere too if you want to do more exploring which is what i did. The room was was big enough for 2 people.Nice bright white walls. tv with lots of channels. funky maze-like hallway design.We chose the room with the bathroom which costed a little bit more. The cheaper rooms have communal washrooms with other guests. I personally don't mind. They're not scary at all and I'm sure some of them are street ppl. But I doubt they're going to rob u or touch u or rape u..Dont be a fool and bring valuables to your vacation.The only thing we didn't like was the lack of parking within hotel premises. There is a separate parking garage across the street which you have to walk to is where i'm guessing where most Cecil guests leave their car. It was either that or an alley. We chose the alley which really wasn't that better. So decide for yourself. I would not recommend the Cecil for a family as it's just not that kind of place you should cram your family into but if you're looking for something nice, affordable, and charming for friends consider the cecil.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE HOTEL!!”
Reviews.Author: ryanmc1982
Reviews.Content: After traveling for over 12hours to get there, we walk in, and yes the lobby does look nice. It appears to be clean, it's bright etc....but that all changes VERY quick. We check in, and go to get in the elevator, we had booked a room with a washroom. The hallways were dingy and dirty looking, we get into our room and it is 100 times worse. There was stains on the bed sheets, there was long hairs in the bath tub, and the room just smelt stale. We went straight back down to the reception desk and informed them of how disgusted we were in the room. The girl at the desk was very nice and helpful I must admit, she informed us that she could transfer us to their sister hotel, the Stay next door. It's not really next door, just a different lobby. When they talk on this site that they have renovated some of the rooms, they mean it alternates by floor, and the newer nice rooms are actually that of the stay. The rooms at the stay were better yea, but still not clean the way I like my place to be. All in all.....stay away from this hotel if you can, there are other much nicer ones in the area for affordable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs - covered in bites”
Reviews.Author: BizTraveling
Reviews.Content: The lobby was nice. Very good business area for getting work done. Room was fair for the price. Bed bugs ensure that I'll never be back. Both my wife and I are covered in bites. Killed a few and left them for the staff to inspect. Hope they take action.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be afraid - Downtown L.A Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: staceylou002
Reviews.Content: Ok...I came to L.A by myself for the first time, *just* because I wanted to go, from England. I booked myself into a more expensive hotel nearer LAX for my first night because I didn't want to travel far from the Airport in the dark and now know where I was. I found an amazing deal on expedia offering the Cecil hotel at £25 per night which I thought was incredible! So, after reading a few positive and negative reviews, I booked 6 nights there. The lobby is just amazing, faux marble or not, and the staff (especially security) are incredible and SO friendly. There are also some real characters living in the Cecil Hotel who I really got on with. My room was pretty much average, if a little too hot at times. My only complaint would be the really high phone bill, although that was most likely my own fault for not understanding how much it costs to call england from the USA (I spent $200 on the phone bill!). The bathroom was clean, as were the sheets, and there was plenty of room to store my things, as well as lots of choice for channels on the Cable T.V. Despite being alone and thousands of miles away from home, I never once felt scared, and everyone I met at the Cecil and around the area made me feel so at home I never wanted to leave. I was never without help if I needed it, and there was always somebody about to tell me what there was to do in the area. All in all, I had the holiday of a lifetime, by myself, for less than £500 to Los Angeles in the Summer. You don't get much better than that! :)

Reviews.Title: “4 Nights at Cecil”
Reviews.Author: ButterflyEffect
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Cecil Hotel for 4 nights. We arrived by Geyhound, and although the station is close, I would not recommend walking to the hotel. This is because the streets surrounding the hotel are full of homeless people, crack heads, and groups of thugs. I had no idea that downtown L.A was such a dodgy area. In most other cities, downtown is the place to be, where everything happens. I guess in L.A you should really be in Hollywood/Beverley Hills area. Unless you need to be in downtown specifically I would suggest not staying or going anywhere near it. Even during the day it's a bit rough. A good thing for us was the price, and the nearby metro station. A couple of blocks away is the metro which will take you everywhere you need to go in L.A - universal studios, hollywood, LAX. I'm pretty sure you can get to Disneyland or at least nearby as well. The front of house staff were also very efficient. The first night we arrived the internet was not working so the lady had the security guard escort us to the hotel next door so we could use theirs, free of charge of course. The room was okay, but it was quite humid and there was only one ceiling fan. The whole time we stayed we could not sleep under any of the bedding because it was too hot. We had an ensuite bathroom which was small but did the job. Everything looked quite clean, but we did spot a cockroach crawling around on one of the walls. I thought it was quite funny until my friend said "if there is one there are probably more!" The hotel lobby is one of the nicest things about the hotel. It is huge, and just upstairs of the lobby there are plenty of tables and chairs so you can take your laptop and surf the net for as long as you want. The internet here is free. We could get a weak signal in our room but it was better to go downstairs and more comfortable anyway. Just left of the hotel (when you are facing it) is a diner called "Nickel Diner" and they do a really nice breakfast there, and great coffee. The staff there were great too. Just ignore the dodgy types hanging around on the street I guess. If you are a lone traveller I would not recommend staying at cecil, and I would not recommend arriving by yourself at night time or walking anywhere on the streets at night. Every time I stepped outside the hotel I would have creepy homeless guys or young thugs proposition me. If you're in a group and you need somewhere cheap to stay then Cecil will be fine. Just make sure you keep an eye on your belongings are are street wise!

Reviews.Title: “Wish I had read the reviews first... WORST HOTEL we've EVER stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: worktravelingcouple
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had to travel to the Fashion District in Los Angelos for business. We travel frequently and had check many of the big name hotels who we prefer to stay with but all were completely booked. After searching online we found The Cecil Hotel. It showed two different types of rooms - ones with no bathroom where you would use a shared bathroom down the hall and ones with a bathroom inside. After looking online at photos that seemed "decent", we decided to book our 2 night stay there in a room with a bathroom. It was very inexpensive, which made no difference to us, as we are accustomed to paying upwards of $200/night when we travel. When we arrived, we were beyond disappointed. The area that the hotel is located in is very unsafe, with many homeless people and drug addicts sleeping on the street right outside the front door. As we entered the lobby, it seemed not too bad. The huge let down was upon getting off the elevator to the floor we were staying on. It was musty, moldy, and downright disgusting smelling and looking. We went to our room to find even bigger let down. The bed was merely an old "cot" with sheets on it -- no blanket or comforter. It didn't make much difference, though -- there is NO Air Conditioner or ventilation unit anywhere. The whole place just felt dirty and uncomfortable. The bathroom (which was supposed to be an "upgrade" at this hotel) was terrible to say the least. Neither my husband or I even wanted to go in there. We were at a loss as to what to do -- we had work meetings starting within an hour. We quickly dropped our bags and left for the day. Upon returning for the evening, we did not feel safe. Although there is a security guard downstairs that asks for your key, it was pretty much a nightmare. Firetrucks and sirens loudly going off every 3-4 minutes all night long, smoke smells coming in from people smoking on the street or in the hallways. We literally could not wait to get up and get out of there in the morning. We walked about 4-5 blocks in each direction from the hotel the next afternoon, just wasting time in between work meetings. We were willing to do anything to avoid having to go back to our hotel room. Much to our surprise, the downtown LA area changes quickly within about 4-5 blocks from this hotel location. Cleaner people, newer buildings, and for once we felt safer. WE SO WISH we had checked the review about The Cecil and opted to change our business trip to different dates where nicer hotels (Marriott, Sheraton, etc) were available. I would highly recommend to anyone traveling for business or pleasure to look elsewhere. I would rather pay $500/night to stay somewhere that was clean, comfortable, and felt safe over ever staying at the Cecil again even for FREE! BEWARE.....

Reviews.Title: “A California college student's opinion”
Reviews.Author: lunastone
Reviews.Content: Okay, here's the deal. This was the cheapest place I could find for two people the week before we needed the room. For the price it was not horrible, but NOT GREAT either. What people said here is true. The front lobby is very nice at first glance. Faux marble is everywhere but it is easy to tell it is just a facade. The young man at the front desk asked me if I was "aware this is a hostel?" I felt like saying, "Are you aware?" because of all the glamor in the entry but I refrained. ::things you should know about me. I stayed on the 11th floor in a room with a double bed. Two girls, one sink, one closet, one TV with remote, one window, one night stand. that's it. I am a female college student who is very very okay with "roughing it". I've done the whole hostel thing before so I know what to expect. I am not squeamish and I do not need to be pampered. "Girlie" has never been a fitting adjective for me. If you are a girliegirl then maybe you will find this place way too gross. just saying.:: There is some sort of restaurant going in next door and people (workers) seem to hang out there all the time Not actually working mind you. They just laugh when you walk buy and you feel like you're not a part of their cool kids club. However I did not find this "tent city" mentioned and I felt quite safe walking around on a saturday night with my female friend. Yes, there were some homeless men calling out to us but nothing bad really. Maybe I am just really used to San Francisco. There always seems to be some sort of maid or handy man in the small, poorly painted elevators and that made me uneasy. Are there no service elevators. These people always seemed unhappy like they hated life. The room was okay. The things that bugged me were that the carpet was a bit damp and over all nothing seemed exceedingly clean. I kept feeling like I needed to wash my hands after touching things. There was no way to really get clean though because the soap they provide you smells like really bad roses. *bring your own hand soap* Also the room smelled. Not fresh at all and no way to air it out since we left the window open all day and that didn't do anything. Just a damp humid smell (outside was not humid for the record). *Think about bringing something to make your room smell better. febreeze it yo.* We brought sleeping bags and pillows after heeding the other reviews of the Cecil Hotel on this site and I think it was a darn good idea. The hostel style bathroom was...ehhhh. There was a bar to hang a towel/clothes. the water pressure was okay. I had no confidence in the walls or floor though so made very sure I never toughed either. scummy marble. yum. The toilets were ALWAYS missing toilet paper which is, let's face it, awkward. And the "vent" in the bathroom was caked with black dust?scum?alien species? The young man at the front desk was helpful and helped me find a few things downtown. I think he was helpful because I was a young girl flirting though and not because it was his job. Overall this is an okay place to stay if you need a cheap room for one, maybe two nights. Will I be back? maaaaybe if I am with my brother or some other person who can really rough it and we need to stay right downtown. I won't be coming back here with any girls who need basic cleanliness needs met. They just won't find it here. I will definitely book a hostel more than three days ahead next time and find one that is rated better!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and brilliant staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: claire_pinkprincess
Reviews.Content: After travelling around America for the last month this is the cleanest and friendliest by far!! As far as first impressions go, we thought we had been dropped off at the wrong hotel due to walking into a huge beautiful lobby!WOW!! We were promptly greeted by who I assume was the manager, and even though we were grumpy from a long day travelling felt instantly relieved by the fast check in and courtious staff. We had a double room for 4 nights and had no problems what so ever. The room was large enough for two people, the bathroom was clean and there was plenty of hot water. The only problems we had was a lack of plug sockets in our room and the room got a little hot with no air-con or fan. However this wasn't even a big enough complaint for us to take it any further than mentioning it to each other. I wish we had known this hotel was so nice as i would have loved to have stopped longer and for the price it is unbeatable! Also free wi-fi in lobby and ask front desk in regards to airport shuttle. As for the area I don't see how the hotel can help this. They have a brilliant guard on in the day and one throughout the night. We also encountered the trawls of homeless people, but they are everywhere in LA. I wouldn't feel comfortable walking the streets past dark anywhere here so would advise a taxi if going out at night. But the tube station on Pershing Square is a fantastic and cheap way to see the whole of LA in the day time. I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone. We had a wonderful stay and would definatley stop again if we came back to LA!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here At Your Own Risk!”
Reviews.Author: On The Go 2000
Reviews.Content: The lobby area is impressive, the service at the front desk, security, and maintenance were very good. However I had room #1442 with a bathroom which I paid with taxes, $80.00 approximately per night. My bathroom sink had whiskers from someone shaving scattered all over it. The temperture in downtown Los Angeles was over 100 degrees. I get to my room and I learn there is no air conditioning, so I learned a very valuable experience, as from now on I will ask prior to renting a room. There is also no refrigerator. The rooms are also very small. Now the most important part of this review. All along the street outside of the hotel it is very dangerous. You have beggers everywhere, you have dope dealers hanging out on the side walks, you have homeless and mentally impaired individuals everywhere. I am 48 years old and I walked 2 blocks from the hotel to pick up my clothes from a tailor, only to be knocked down by 2 young thugs in there 20's. They tried to rob me without success. When I returned to the hotel, I walked down one block, and took a back way back to the hotel. I am white and these kids were giving me a very hard time about my white skin, all the while trying to kick me and hit me.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Deal in Los Angeles, CA.”
Reviews.Author: Travel'inged
Reviews.Content: The Cecil Hotel is situated right between the Jewelry Mart and close to the Garment District , the neighborhood is named 'The Cort'. Parking right next door is $20.00 per 24 hours, or across the street it is $10.00 per 24 hours... a real bargain in downtown. They have just remodeled the hotel, the Art Deco lobby is the most pleasing. The rooms are smallish, 1 full or 2 twin beds with 1/2 bath or full bath for $10.00 more, for those who choose 1/2 baths, the community showers are private and located in the hallways. There is no a/c, just a ceiling fan in room. Vending machines are located just off the lobby. There is an adjacent small convenience store open morning to night, snacks, soft drinks, fresh fruit, newspapers, etc...There is going to be an average restaurant opening also located just off the lobby soon. The closest chain restaurant is an I.H.O.P. The neighborhood seems to be a bit seedy at night time, but there are police cars cruising regularly. Having said all this, it's the best bet for 2 adults @ $65.00 per night, and less for 1 adult in the downtown area. The front desk is very friendly, there is even a concierge on duty from morning to night !

Reviews.Title: “fear,fear,fear”
Reviews.Author: an0nim0us_
Reviews.Content: strange and frightening people prowling along the corridors. we were afread taking the elevators and reaching to our room. a pro: thanks to the guard who accompanied us several times to the room.

Reviews.Title: “A nightmare on main street!”
Reviews.Author: mart09876
Reviews.Content: i turned up at the cecil hotel for a 3 night stay, and the lobby area seemed nice but as i approached my room things got worse! the door had looked like it had been kicked in and had several bolts on the door that was un-nerving! despite the loud noise outside i slept ok the first night but it was second was more like a horror film. i was awoken in the middle of the night by a cockroach crawling across my face, and then finding around 10 more in my bed with me! i then found the room was swarming in them! i checked out soon after, and the hotel staff did not even seem concerned! The outside area was also the dodgiest place ive ever been to! do not go here!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here Under Any Circumstance.”
Reviews.Author: nycwestvillage
Reviews.Content: I pull up to the hotel in my rental car where I'm greeted by a hotel employee. I ask if they have parking. He says no, but I can park the car in a metered spot while I check in. The meter is broken, I look around for no parking signs, there are none, so I figure I'm good. I enter the lobby which looks ok enough, except there's a homeless guy slurping on a coffee in what appears to be some sort of automat like area which opens onto the lobby. OK, I'm from NYC, so homeless guys aren't a big deal, but certainly starts to raise a red flag. I get to the check-in and the receptionist tells me the hotel does not have parking. But I'm welcome to park the car in one of the two lots surrounded by torn up chain link fences either across the street, or beside the hotel I think it was either 5 to 10 dollars, but no in and out privileges. Sounds weird, but I ask her where I can get some money to pay for the parking. She tells me there's an atm in that deli/automat where I saw the homeless guy, but by the afternoon, the atm is usually out of money. So my best bet is a bank a few blocks away. I ask her if my car will be ok outside, since I'll have to take my baggage up to the room to then go to the atm. She says don't worry at all, your car will be fine out there for the rest of the night if you like. So I take the elevator up to the room where I'm greeted by open doors on the hallways of shared bathrooms. They looked clean enough I suppose, but still, that's not what you want to be greeted with, multiple shared bathrooms--it really gave the feeling of a flophouse. I get to the room a door so flimsy it looks like it couldn't stop a light breeze from entering. The room was clean enough, but small with an en suite bathroom, the mattress was cheap and the room smelled like smoke. I guess this is one of the few hotels in LA that still has smoking... Anyway, there's no internet in the room despite the claim that there was wifi in the hotel, so having work to do for most of the night and internet being crucial, I decide combined with the smell of smoke and the general overall creepiness of the hotel, I can't stay there. I talk to orbitz about the situation, and they say the manager refuses to let me out of the reservation and will charge me for a night, despite the pretty much false advertising this place has given. That's when somebody asks if I'm the person with the rental car out front. I say yes, and they say, we were trying to get in touch with you because it was getting towed. I say, you're joking right? Nope, my car was towed. After 2 employees told me it would be ok. So now they agree to refund me my first night as well, but at this point I'm a tow ($150) and a ticket ($75) in the hole. So the only thing this manager can say is I'm sorry, then he kinda just acts like people do when they aren't really sorry they try and make themselves scarce. Not "how can we help make this up to you" or "what can we do to help," no, just "I'm sorry about that." To his credit he did find the number of the towing company for me so I could find out how much I was now in the hole thanks to their incompetence. While I'm at the desk by the way, the strangest cast of characters who stay there, or wanted to stay there came up. One guy was trying to decide whether paying 3 bucks more a night for a TV in his room was worth it. Flophouse. So after I regain my composure, I say you telling me you're "sorry" isn't enough. Don't you think the hotel should share some of the responsibility of having my car towed? His response was "no, if it's money you're looking for you won't get it, we already refunded you for the first night." Which was a joke since they really should have anyway considering how they advertised themselves. Finally I tell him this report is going to go on Trip Advisor and that's when he immediately changes his tune. Then he says he'll talk to management as see if they'll agree. I say, look just pay for half and show you're sharing some responsibility in this, and I'll feel much less anger toward your establishment which I thought was totally fair. I leave and after another hour of dealing with getting 250 bucks out of the bank and having a friend come by to help me find the towing pound, I was not a happy camper. The hotel cecil manager did call to say they agreed to cover half the towing. Not the ticket, ONLY the towing. So I think ok, I guess that's something and they're doing the honorable thing. We fax over the towing receipt as they asked us to do, and two months later, still no check. I assume it's not coming, which just proves how incompetent they are, bordering on just full-on scam artists, and dishonorable. Well, here's your trip advisor review Hotel Cecil. And I think I'm being kinder than anybody would be under the circumstances I was put in. Pros: Cheap Security Guards in Marble Lobby. Free wifi in Lobby area. Cons: Security Guards in Lobby. (They're there for a reason) Crackheads (I kid you not) stumbling down street in front of hotel as I wait for my friend to pick me up. No parking. Room/Hallways smelled like smoke. Incompetent staff. Summary: Saving a few bucks a night in this place is NOT worth the hassle. Not to mention the location is in the worst part of LA. If you want to experience the LA you've seen in the movies (unless you are attracted to the LA you saw in "Seven") stay anywhere else. This place is horrible. Period. I can't believe Orbitz would even offer this place as a package/hotel on their site.

Reviews.Title: “Un Professional People Trying To Look Busy/Working”
Reviews.Author: spacetimewalker
Reviews.Content: They recently started renovating but some of the mattresses and furniture still have bed bugs. I saw a maid and one of the security guys making out in the hallway. You need to watched the house cleaning people closely, they stole my umbrella. The hallways are windy and cold. And one night I woke up to find the sink in the room had flooded the floor. This happened around 12:00a.m. and again around 4:00 a.m. My things in the closet were soaked. I'm not sure how often they are inspected by the city. They seem to get away with a lot. It's like I read in another review of this hotel, you have to watch your back.

Reviews.Title: “good for the price”
Reviews.Author: 2steps-ahead
Reviews.Content: We spent a night in a queen-bed room on Dec 30, 07 and paid for $45. The room is clean, but small with a tiny and very old bathroom. Lobby might be the best area in this old hotel and they're renovating other areas. The hotel is in LA Downtown, which is quite quiet during the night, but seems to be safe even at midnight. We didn't see that many homeless as other reviews mentioned, probably, because it's too cold. Overall, If you just want a place to sleep, this is the place for you. If you want to spend more time in the room, look for another place. goods: cheap, short walk to bus/subway station bads: small room, far from attractions, not so impressive surroundings

Reviews.Title: “If you are Asian, you will find it aceptable”
Reviews.Author: Thriftytreats
Reviews.Content: Yes, I agree the hotel does have areas to improve. However, I find the hotel really value for money. You may feel a little uncomfortable with more "non-white" staying at the hotel. I stayed there for 5 nights with my families and somehow figure out the place is real convenient. Right in front of the hotel, there is bus no. 33 take you to Union station door step where you can get connected to all the metro lines and train as well as long haul bus such as megabus. Right across on the right, you have bus to Disney land. During the day, 6th street, and 7th street is bustling with activities and you can have very affordable meals like USD2.00 for a breakfast set and USD 6.00 for a good mexican meal. IT stuff is also much cheaper here. I bought a 2 gb SD card for my camera in one of the shop near hotel at USD35 while hollywood sold a USD99 and Las Vegas USD69.00 The short coming is at time wrong key is given. Hence, ensure you have your room latched. The furnishing of the room is good for the price, it comes with TV, phone, shower, heater, fan. Short coming, no coffee and tea facility as well as hair dryer. However, they do have laundry service at the lobby. There is a small convenient stall at the lobby. Be sure you buy enough drinking water to the hotel purchased from a mart. Food supply night is not readily available though you can order pizza delivery.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for, and a little more”
Reviews.Author: davefan124
Reviews.Content: So if you're just in town for a day or two and don't want to pay an obscene amount for an average hotel, definitely stay here. Don't expect much, but for the price, it's unbeatable! They're revamping the place slowly, so make sure when you book, you ask for a new room. Though even if you don't, like we forgot, the room you'll get is clean as can be. Make sure you get a room with it's own full bathroom. It's an old hotel so there are some rooms that don't have a bathroom inside and then you have to share, which you DO NOT want to do. The hotel itself is well worth the price. Really the only thing we ran into as far as not impressed were the people that stay there. It's a variety, but you can tell that the local druggies do rent I'm sure by the week, they stick to themselves though and we didn't run into any problems. What's great, is that it's close to everything, train station, Staples Center, just easy to get to. But whatever you do, don't eat at the midnight food place next door, lol, it's a grease pit.

Reviews.Title: “Was great for a while, but a problem”
Reviews.Author: TorontoEricLA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this place a number of times on my trips to LA. Everything was OK by me, I always got my favorite room. Never had a problem until one night there is a banging on my door late at night. I answered and a security guard pushed his way into my room saying he had a noise complaint. Standing outside my door he could have heard if there was any noise or not, but instead he chose to knock and push his way in. He looked in my TV cabinet and then even looked in my clothes closet, then just non-chalantly said "go back to sleep" and left my room. I got dressed and went over to a police precinct a short walk away and complained. The police came back to the hotel with me, one spoke to me, the other to the guard. The next day I went out in the morning for a short time and came back to find a metal plug in my room lock. When I went down and questioned why, they told me I had to leave because I called the police when the security guy was only doing his job. Looking back now, I guess I over-reacted by going to the police, but I couldn't understand why this particular guard did this, because the guards knew me well from coming and going for a few years previous to that visit.
