I was always on "hello" basis with all of them because I was in and out often on my trips and sometimes they didn't even bother to check my ID any more when I went in and out. I guess I'd stay there again if I had to because the price is unbeatable, but on my visits now I stay at similar place just up the street.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Deal at the Cecil!”
Reviews.Author: smagnew
Reviews.Content: After attending a function downtown, my friend and I decided to make a night of it and book a room at the Cecil. Having some initial reservations about the area, I must say that I was absolutely surprised in the most pleasant way possible by this establishment. The lobby was amazing - immaculately clean, tasteful, well-lit, and very inviting. The staff was so courteous and helpful, a real treat these days. Our room was clean and cozy, and management was exceedingly gracious even when we accidentally slept in after checkout time. And all this for an unbelieveably affordable price. Definitely recommend this place for anyone staying downtown!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Time at the Cecil”
Reviews.Author: snino
Reviews.Content: My friend had a birthday party downtown in the Historic Core. There are a bunch of new bars opening up in this part of downtown so to make a night of it, we decided to book some rooms at the Cecil Hotel. We were impressed with the hip look of the hotel, the staff was courteous and the rooms were clean. We had a great time and I would definitely consider staying again. The price was right and it was walking distance from the bar so you can't beat that.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: peter6Ca
Reviews.Content: I was recommended by another hotel due to sold out. I was very surprised when I walked in. it is a honest hotel with honest priced rooms, bit old style but you can’t beat the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!! great rooms, great prices and great people”
Reviews.Author: samfireitness
Reviews.Content: I cant say enough about the Cecil Hotel. The rates are very affordable and for the price you get a super clean room, movie channels, maid service, the works. The staff was very friendly and was on hand to answer any questions I had. The room was cleaned daily and on time. The central location was perfect and just a short walk away from the subway. With the resent renovations that downtown has undergone, it is a safe, clean area and I cant wait for my next visit. I will be using the Cecil hotel every time I visit Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “It's a bit scary”
Reviews.Author: Gnobro
Reviews.Content: This place is located in one of the worst parts of downtown LA. There's piles of trash on the street corners five feet tall. When returning to the hotel at night I was not happy to see several police officers with full body armor guarding the entrance to the the hotel. There's some sort of strange eatery on the corner that's open nearly 24x7 and thusly attracts a lot of strange people. There's no overnight parking in the area. The rooms were filthy, the plumbing is circa 1960s. My bedspread had cigarrette burns in it, my chair had a knife slash in it. The room smelled of fresh vomit when I arrived and it did not have AC. The bathroom towels had stains on them and the water coming out of the tap was brown. The doors have 4 locks on them and trust me you'll feel like you need them. I lost track of the number of drunks I saw, and at one point had to ride in the elevator with a woman who was obviously on drugs and had a stun gun that she kept clickin on and off at her side. Basically I do not recommend staying here unless you have no choice.

Reviews.Title: “wake up call?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: hotel cecil, granted it looks like an ok hotel it isnt...bathroom messy and our wake up call was a man bangin on our door trying to get inside our room...avoid

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly staff & good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my second time here. Last year it took some getting used to the area, like New York, But this time I Noticed a big improvement, both on the streets and, inside the Hotel. The bottom line, for me, is anyplace that is clean, with free movie channels, for under 50 bucks a nite, IS For me.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID!”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous006
Reviews.Content: The lobby looks "decent", but in the entrance there are guards looking after people who enter and get out because the street is SCARY. The elevator smells horrible (well, the hallways upstairs too) And when I was standing near the entrance waiting for a cab to pick me up (and leave) a big guy entered with a HUGE fridge box. The ___ dropped it and it nearly fell over me, he could have killed me. At night, it IS even more scary. DON'T GO HERE!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hey. n I read some of the posted comments before going but I had friends who stayed last summer from Italy there and liked it. My firends were right. I found the staff friendly, the Hotel spotless and I had a good view room nicer than the Holiday Inn I just stayed at in San Francisco. I was surprised to have lots of movie channels included. Staff showed me how to get to the subway 3 blocks away and tourist maps of the city, universal etc. Security was tight but I prefer it that way rather than some of the other loose hotels Ive stayed at. I'll be back with friends.

Reviews.Title: “want to get mugged?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: hotel cecil is a fine establishment - - that is if you are looking to be mugged, harassed by junkies, winos etc. and by all means do not take your women folk, children to the area. in the heart of skid row and very dangerous.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended for tourists”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want to live on the Wild Side then this place is for you. If not... stay away. The hotel looks nice and all, the people who work there are nice, BUT... the other residents who you'd share the place with are scary as hell. People from all walks of life live there, and you all should know the reputation of LA poor people. Things you will find in hotel: 1. 2 Security guards constantly on patrol. Have to pass through them and be checked to enter building 2. A sign that reads "if you sell drugs or take drugs in this building you will be arrested". 3. When you ask the receptionist what is there to do around downtown LA at night "Sorry sir, we do not recommend our guests to be walking around the streets at night" 4. There are 4 locks on your hotel room door. Don't think all this is extra precautions... as i found out the hard way.. there is a purpose for all this.... to keep you safe... from the other tennants and people on the block. This is not a hotel for tourist..only locals.

Reviews.Title: “don't go there. part 2”
Reviews.Author: cheryl721
Reviews.Content: I had a bad experience at this hotel. the area is an unsafe one. I went to booked a room at this hotel they wanted a birth certificate for my young child. and they wanted to charge me for my child as a double but didn't want to give me an extra bed. If i'm paying for a 6 yo i want an extra bed??? After the manager gave me a reheareased speech. I told him I was going to report him. He then refused me a room. I was in a new city with no place to stay with a young child. Luckily I had 2 other back up hotels. I booked a room at Kawada Hotel which is in a better section of downtown LA. Staff were friendly, rooms was small but well equipped. I'd paid merely $40 more for the 5 days but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I know the hotel management is trying to make this hotel nicer with remodeling the lobby, but this hotel is, in a word, scary. The employees are behind glass that has signs warning against drug dealing in the hotel. There was no place to park except on the street. This is not a good area to be in at night.

HotelInfo.Name: Cecil Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 640 S. Main Street, Los Angeles, CA 90014
